embeds.title: Pilot's Codex
embeds.description:
Uncommon Relic / The Guardian / Downfall

If you end your turn with no cards in **Stasis,** choose 1 of 3 cards to place into **Stasis.**
*Designs and diagrams of the Spire's earliest manually-driven prototypes, by Master Pilot David.*

messages.content:
This relic is pretty OK, not amazing, but acceptable. It has the same advantages as Nilry's of letting you have access to situational cards that you don't need, without having to bloat your deck, plus generating a virtual card draw and some energy. In the first few turns of a fight, if I haven't found my infinite yet, it is not rare for me to get at least one trigger out of this. 

Out of that whole list ShinBlitz posted, I take Sentry Blast quite frequently (which clashes badly with this relic), Stasis Field sometimes, and Suspension a lot. I skip every other card listed 98+% of the time which is probably why my evaluation of the relic differs from the previous commentors.

Almost none of those other cards do a good job of carrying me forward to an infinite, and they are all effectively Curses of one kind or another afterwards. Sentry Blast, the clear exception, is a great source of free recurring damage and therefore a good carrying card.
I would seldom to never buy this relic from a shop but I don't frown or scoff if I happen to pick it up.
Low C tier to high D tier
oh right there's also recover which i forgot about
but yeah you basically want a lot of accelerate and few to no cards that need to go into stasis/send other cards into stasis
The only way to trigger this card is if you have a billion accelerate cards I'm talking <incinerate+><speed boost><amber>in bauble burst and <emergency+>

​~~- **Exhaust**. -~~

messages.content: and you have to *not* already have drafted a significant number of stasis cards
Yep future plans becomes a dead card
And you have to burn through tick effects immediately
I will admit however there's some very good stuff you could generate with it such as <clone> or <spheric shield> hell even one of the above cards mentioned

messages.content: https://discord.com/channels/669242017427226638/1171177883868344451/1172274756586831983 hey, popping in a bit late to announce that another bracket vote is going on
this will activate on turn 1 if you have bad luck maybe 1-2 times a run, and do literally nothing else.
I don't think I've played with this much. I suppose it's not particularly good
make it rare and activate as long as you have an open slot and boom it's similar to Nilry's.
Too strong? Just make it two options instead of 3.

its good for Unga bunga guardian decks that just try to kill every single enemy by playing gem cannon once. But this makes one of your starter cards dead (or if you play it then the relic becomes dead) and your probably going to have something that put another card in stasis long before you even see this relic.

even in Unga bunga decks you still value having cards do stasis though even if its just for the 1 enemy in the game you cannot one shot. although I thin its fine to just start ignoring pilets codex by act 3/4

This relic has no business even being discussed, but gem cannon is so powerful that it single handily can create a deck that makes this relic acutally do something (but even when it does activate pilot's codex is still really swingy since its making random cards and you could just get trash)
This is like Nilry's codex but if it only worked if you played 2 or less cards that turn
aka Nilry's with a really specific condition that must be met

I'm shocked to see anyone defending this. Stasis is so central to playing guardian that I can't even begin to imagine what having a deck that doesn't put cards in stasis looks like. Sure, you could play a ton of accelerate to free up slots, but there are only a few accelerate cards in the pool, and just because you free up slots with accelerate doesn't mean that you will free them all up, or that you wouldn't have more new cards that you'd like to put into those freed up slots. This thing might trigger once at the start of a fight if you get really unlucky (and I tend to play decks full or reroute/recover that would never run into that problem), and even that would still be a very weak common relic. I also tend to really like orb support as an effective way to help speed up guardians naturally slow gameplan and give them a bit more frontloaded damage, and that also makes triggering this much harder. In order for this relic to ever do anything you have to have built your deck completely wrong or gotten incredibly unlucky, so it's dead most of the time. 

This really ought to be reworked or scrapped, at the very least the condition should be changed to ending your turn with an empty stasis slot or something more likely to happen than having NO cards in stasis at all.
It's not that you can't put cards into stasis it's just that they can't be there in the end of turn
Which makes many cards worse
But yeah making this an unconditional rare is for the best
Otherwise this just won't be used at all
Oh wait I just realized pilots codex literally bricks itself
Man this relic sucks
~~nilry’s but it only works if you are standing on your head~~
